extendedIngredients.name: dark brown sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup dark brown sugar, packed

extendedIngredients.name: graham crackers
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup hand-crushed graham crackers, NOT fine crumbs

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
semisweet chocolate chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup mini semisweet chocolate chips

extendedIngredients.name: sugar free raspberry gelatin
extendedIngredients.originalString: 10-11 large gelatin-free marshmallows (see notes), cut in half

recipes.title: Marshmallow-Stuffed S’mores Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies on the menu? Try pairing with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a small bowl, combine the flour, salt, soda, and baking powder. Set aside.Cream the butter for a minute or two, then pour in the sugar and mix until light and fluffy. Mix in the honey, and then beat in the eggs.Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Fold in the chocolate chips, and then gently fold in the graham cracker pieces.Refrigerate the dough for at least 1 hour.Preheat oven to 350 degrees.Scoop up 1 tablespoon of dough, roll into a ball, flatten, and set down on a parchment-lined cookie sheet. Set the marshmallow right in the middle. Top with another tablespoon of flattened dough and press together. Repeat with remaining dough.Bake for 10-13 minutes, until the sides are golden. Let sit on the cookie sheet for a couple minutes, and then transfer to a cooling rack.

steps.step: In a small bowl, combine the flour, salt, soda, and baking powder. Set aside.Cream the butter for a minute or two, then pour in the sugar and mix until light and fluffy.

Mix in the honey, and then beat in the eggs.Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Fold in the chocolate chips, and then gently fold in the graham cracker pieces.Refrigerate the dough for at least 1 hour.Preheat oven to 350 degrees.Scoop up 1 tablespoon of dough, roll into a ball, flatten, and set down on a parchment-lined cookie sheet. Set the marshmallow right in the middle. Top with another tablespoon of flattened dough and press together. Repeat with remaining dough.
Bake for 10-13 minutes, until the sides are golden.
Let sit on the cookie sheet for a couple minutes, and then transfer to a cooling rack.
